revised_title: Inbreeding, Hatching Failure, and Genetic Similarity in Blue Tits
tldr: This study investigates the effects of inbreeding on hatching success in blue tits using DNA fingerprinting. The research finds that the proportion of unhatched eggs in a clutch is related to the degree of genetic similarity between the parents. The results do not support the hypothesis that female blue tits engage in extra-pair copulations to reduce inbreeding depression. Instead, inbreeding may explain the occurrence of unhatched eggs in nests.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
